title: Book of Hours, Use of Paris (The Susanna Hours)
additional_titles: Ownership note of Simon de Gamaches, in French|Calendar, in French|Gospel Lessons|Poem, in French, "O benoist Iesuchrist, Qui mort et passion..."|Passion according to Saint John|Poem, in French, "En Babiloyne estoit ung noble personnaige..."|Hours of the Virgin (Matins)|Poem, in French, "Susanne (en son vergier) pleine de grande beaulté..."|Hours of the Virgin (Lauds)|Poem, in French, "Les deux servantes hors, Et le vergier bien clos..."|Hours of the Cross (Matins)|Poem, in French, "Susanne a haulte voix piteusement exclame..."|Hours of the Holy Spirit (Matins)|Poem, in French, "Serviteurs esbahys. Et ce sceu par la ville..."|Hours of the Holy Virgin (Prime)|Poem, in French, "Susanne délicate et la face très belle..."|Hours of the Virgin (Terce)|Poem, in French, "Ces prêstres disoyent. Dieu l'ésprit suscite..."|Hours of the Virgin (Vespers)|Poem, in French, "Le peuple retourne. Les deux vieillards tout doulx..."|Hours of the Holy Spirit (Compline)|Poem, in French, "Les vieillards divisés. L'enfant l'un interrogue..."|Poem, in French, "Susanne adsoulte fut du crime et vitupère..."|Penitential Psalms, Litany, and Prayers|Poem, in French, "Les deux prestres vieillards et faulx accusateurs..."|Office of the Dead|Poem, in French, "Doulce Royne des cieux, humble vierge pucelle..."|Obsecro te, followed by O intemerata, Stabat Mater, and a Prayer to the Conception of the Virgin Mary|Poem, in French, "Indivisible Saincte et haulte trinité..."|Suffrages for Male Saints|Suffrages for Female Saints|Additional Suffrages|Added prayer, in French, "O doulx croix signe resplendissant..."|Early ownership notes
